main event: On 1 July 1956, a strange object resembling a blue ball with a dark blue streak trailing was sighted approximately 17 miles east of Columbus, Ohio, traveling from north to south-west at an estimated altitude of 4000 feet. The report was provided by the pilot of a TWA aircraft and a member of the Columbus Fire Department to the Columbus Tower.
interesting points: The object appeared larger than an aircraft and was observed to be traveling at a significant altitude and speed.
The sighting was reported by credible witnesses, including the pilot of a TWA aircraft and a member of the Columbus Fire Department.
The report indicates that the object was observed visually and that photographs were taken during the sighting.
The observation was classified as a 'probable observation' by the Air Defense Command, but was noted to have insufficient data for justification.
The sighting report was received on 13 July 1956, with the exact length of the observation being unknown.
sighted object: strange object resembling a blue ball with a dark blue streak trailing
witnesses: pilot of a TWA aircraft, member of the Columbus Fire Department
